arts.ttl: Bayern Munich’s Harry Kane laments lapse of concentration in frustrating loss to VfL Bochum
arts.sum: Being given a rare rest in the tight schedule of games, Harry Kane came on in the 62nd minute against Bochum. Despite their attempts, Bayern not only failed to score a third goal, but conceded another goal to Bochum and lost the game 2-3.

arts.ttl: Liverpool transfer news latest: Bayern Munich star linked as Arne Slot plots future without Mohamed Salah
arts.sum: Reports claim that Liverpool are looking to reinforce in attack, with enquires made for a Bayern Munich star amidst reports that Mohamed Salah will leave Anfield.

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany discusses Bayern Munich’s 2-3 loss to VfL Bochum
arts.sum: Also, be sure to stay tuned to Bavarian Podcast Works for all of your up to date coverage on Bayern Munich and Germany. Listen with us in this edition of the Bavarian Podcast Works Postgame Show and share your thoughts in the comments about a shock 2-3 home defeat at the Allianz that spoiled Bayern Munich’s 125th anniversary celebrations.

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany slams Bayern Munich players and admits they've left him 'angry'
arts.sum: Bayern Munich were brought down to earth with a bump by Bochum on Saturday, having led 2-0 only to collapse to a 3-2 defeat - and Vincent Kompany was not happy

arts.ttl: João Palhinha left Allianz Arena before all other players after Bayern Munich’s 3-2 loss to VfL Bochum
arts.sum: Bayern went into the halftime interval 2-1 up, but they were forced to play the second half with 10 men after João Palhinha saw a straight red card for a stamp on Bochum’s Georgios Masouras in a 50/50 challenge where the Portuguese international did clearly win the ball first before any contact on the Bochum player. There was controversy surrounding Palhinha’s straight red since the midfielder certainly made a play on the ball and only caught Masouras on the follow through with little time to be able to do anything about it.
Bochum’s coach hailed his team’s comeback win over Rekordmeister Bayern Munich.

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany believes João Palhinha’s red card did not influence Bayern Munich’s 2-3 loss to VfL Bochum
arts.sum: “We’ll talk about this moment, but it shouldn’t be an excuse. What was meant to be a celebration at home turned into a nightmare, as the Bavarians were defeated 2-3 by VfL Bochum.

arts.ttl: Three Observations from Bayern Munich’s chaotic 3-2 loss against VfL Bochum
arts.sum: Bayern head coach Vincent Kompany finally rotated in an attempt to manage the player workload before the second leg clash against Leverkusen in the Champions League on Tuesday. Bochum tried to take advantage of the weak midfield to create quick counters and found some success, but that was truly amplified following Joåo Palhinha’s red card.

arts.ttl: Match Awards from Bayern Munich’s 2-3 birthday blunder against VfL Bochum
arts.sum: Hear me out, already one goal up, Jakov Medić takes a massive gamble and brings Leroy Sané down, preventing a very likely goal at the cost of a penalty that Serge Gnabry ultimately puts wide of the mark. The unfortunate medical situation drew some of the attention away from an action packed half, including three goals a penalty miss and a red card.

arts.ttl: Bavarian Podcast Works — Postgame Show: Bayern Munich 2-3 VfL Bochum (Bundesliga)
arts.sum: Bayern Munich were stunned at home on their 125th anniversary celebration. Bayern Munich’s 125th anniversary celebration didn’t go as planned.
